alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 12:48PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT AREAS SOUTH OF KENDRICK PEAK IN COCONINO COUNTY THROUGH 115 PM MST... At 1247 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northwest of Parks. This storm was building to the west and southwest around 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, lightning, heavy rain, and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kaibab Lake Campground. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 near mile marker 171. State Route 64 between mile markers 186 and 199. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to minor flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
